org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.message

Class SeRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.message.SeRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public final class SeRequest
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    List of APDU requests that will result in a SeResponse
    See Also:
    SeResponse, Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  SeRequest.AidSelector 
      static class  SeRequest.AtrSelector 
      static class  SeRequest.Selector
      The Selector inner class is dedicated to handle the selection of the SE either through a selection command with AID (AtrSelector) or through a matching test between the SE ATR and a regular expression (AtrSelector).

    • Constructor Detail

      • SeRequest

        public SeRequest(SeRequest.Selector selector,
                 java.util.List<ApduRequest> apduRequests,
                 ChannelState channelState,
                 SeProtocol protocolFlag,
                 java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> successfulSelectionStatusCodes)
        The constructor called by a ProxyReader in order to open a logical channel, to send a set of APDU commands to a SE application, or both of them.
        • For SE requiring an AID based selection, the Selector should be defined with a non null byte array.
        • For SE requiring an ATR based selection, the Selector should be defined with a non null String regular expression.
        • For SE supporting neither AID selection nor ATR selection, the Selector should be defined as null.
        • The protocolFlag parameter is optional.
        Parameters:
        selector - the SE selector
        apduRequests - the apdu requests
        channelState - the keep channel open
        protocolFlag - the expected protocol
        successfulSelectionStatusCodes - a list of successful status codes for the select application command

      • SeRequest

        public SeRequest(java.util.List<ApduRequest> apduRequests,
                 ChannelState channelState)
        Constructor to be used when the SE is already selected
        Parameters:
        apduRequests - a list of ApudRequest
        channelState - a flag to tell if the channel has to be closed at the end
